obfuscated_plot: A divorced mother of two meets a married man while sharing a taxi in a large city. He is attracted to her and invites her to tea, then lunch, and eventually suggests they have sex. She agrees but expresses her desire to have uncomplicated sex in a sunny location. He arranges a trip to a coastal resort in a southern European country. Their plans are disrupted when his wife unexpectedly shows up. To hide their affair, he pretends that she is his mother. He cancels the plane tickets he had arranged for his family and encounters his friend, a movie producer, at the airport. Unable to admit that he is with her, he spends the flight next to his friend while she sits elsewhere. Upon arriving at the destination, he gives the last decent rental car to his friend to get rid of him. He ends up driving a foreign car with an awkward clutch, causing discomfort and annoyance to her. They struggle up several flights of stairs to reach their hotel room. Their first night together becomes awkward as they argue about their preferences during sex. He injures his back, requiring medical attention and sleep. In the morning, she encounters another woman but declines her invitation to dinner. He wakes up to find her sunbathing on the balcony and they finally have sex. He becomes disappointed when she does not show enthusiasm afterward, leading to anger and tension between them. During a golf game, she takes offense at his competitive nature against a local boy. The tension continues to mount, and she decides to have dinner with the other woman while he arranges dinner with his friend. To their surprise, she discovers that the other woman is his friend's wife, leading to an uncomfortable dinner for the four of them. After an argument in their hotel room, they decide to return to their original city. At the airport, they realize that the last two plane tickets have been sold. Frustrated, they return to the hotel room and start attacking each other playfully. The situation turns humorous, and their relationship begins to blossom. His friend and wife notice the developing relationship. His friend shares his own experience of a holiday romance and warns him that it won't work out. Despite this, he expresses his desire to continue seeing her when they return to the city. They rent a secret flat together, concealing their affair. As their relationship progresses, it becomes more complicated. She puts in a lot of effort to be with him, but he often disappoints her. He rushes off after sex without realizing that she has prepared a lavish meal for him. She tries to seek companionship with her gay coworker, but he is unavailable. He feels guilty and brings flowers to her, only to leave without saying a word. The tension between them grows, and his coworkers become aware of something going on. He tries to meet her in the evening but forgets that he has plans with his wife. When his wife calls, he is unable to reach her, and she sees him and his wife together at the theater. She feels betrayed and confronts him when he finally arrives at their flat. The next morning, he sends a telegram to end their relationship but changes his mind and rushes to the flat; but she has already received the telegram and begins packing to leave. As he arrives, he sees her standing at a bus stop. Despite his efforts to get her attention, she leaves in a taxi that another man had hailed. She asks the man if he is married, and upon his affirmative response, she walks away, leaving the taxi for him. The story concludes with her moving on from the failed affair and finding a new direction in her life.
